task_summary: Robot detects the T-shaped block, approaches, sets tool yaw, executes a primary leftward push toward the outlined target, performs small corrective pushes, and retreats.
assumptions: pushing dynamics are predictable under friction

node_specs.description: Store symbolic identifiers for later nodes.
Checks if the target is currently visible.
Active search when the target is not visible.
Verify arrival at a symbolic pose.
Establish gentle contact and align to push direction.
Orient the tool about the vertical axis.
Apply a directional push with a set travel distance.

recovery_strategy: scan for target and retry MoveTo
apply corrective short Push in orthogonal/primary direction
retreat and re-approach if contact lost

local_annotations.note: EE approaches block_T; goal_T_outline visible on left.
Closing in to establish pushing contact.
Initial contact on block edge; yaw aligned.
Block reaches outline; corrective alignment begins.
EE retreats; block remains near target.

expected_success_criteria: block_T lies within goal_T_outline after pushes
EE retreats by at least 0.1 m
